column4: hi, i'm trying to install ubuntu server... i'd like to crypt the partition... should i use the automatic tool to use the whole hd with lvm and crypt ? will it ask the passphrase at every boot or will it be automatic the decrypt?
It'll ask for the passphrase at every boot. Why bother using encryption if you want it to perform automatic decryptions. :(

i actually don't want that other people access the data... but as it's a server i don't want the passphrase because i'd have to write it... and with remote access it's quite hard, and not good (the server will stay down until i enter it)

You can use guided partition options or do it manually -- It's really up to you. With scripts, you can have it decrypted automatically if you have USB with passphrase_key loaded in. You should keep the data exclusively to yourself.
